suncertify.db

Class BookingDBFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • suncertify.db.BookingDBFactory

  • public class BookingDBFactory
extends java.lang.Object
    This factory class is used to make instances of classes that implement the BookingDB interface.

    The constructor takes a Configuration object as its argument which specifies the mode of operation that is required, either server, standalone client or remote network client.

    The appropriate implementation of BookingDB will be returned when getBookingDB is called based on the specified operating mode.

    Author:
    Nick Shrine

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected Configuration config
      Specifies the mode of operation and therefore which implementation of BookingDB this class should return.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BookingDBFactory(Configuration config)
      Constructs a new factory object which will create objects that implement the BookingDB interface whose implementation is determined by the specified Configuration.

    • Constructor Detail

      • BookingDBFactory

        public BookingDBFactory(Configuration config)
        Constructs a new factory object which will create objects that implement the BookingDB interface whose implementation is determined by the specified Configuration.
        Parameters:
        config - the Configuration object that specifies the mode of operation.
        See Also:

    • Method Detail

      • getBookingDB

        public BookingDB getBookingDB()
                       throws InvalidDataFileException,
                              java.io.IOException,
                              java.rmi.RemoteException,
                              java.rmi.NotBoundException
        Returns the appropriate implementation of the BookingDB interface based on the mode of operation specified when this factory class was initialised.
        Returns:
        an object that implements the BookingDB interface to be used by clients for accessing the database.
        Throws:
        InvalidDataFileException - If the file specified by config is not a valid data file.
        java.io.IOException - If there is a problem accessing the data file.
        java.rmi.RemoteException - If there is a communication problem with the server.
        java.rmi.NotBoundException - If a remote instance of a Server object is not bound in the JNDI namespace.
        See Also:
        BookingDB
